That delay won't matter to a smart Zed player. I've even heard so from a PBE tester.

But it makes the difference between Zed being a solid champion and Zed being FotM.

"pbe tester"

you mean a place where 12 yrs old tests a new skin that they cant buy?
No, I'm talking about an actual Zed main. But you can sling ad hominem at a random player whose name I didn't bother to disclose, if it suits your taste.
By any chance, would you be talking about Redmercy?
PBE access is by invite only from Riot, only those serious about testing are allowed on there.

Really? I thought they announced a purging of PBE accounts and restrictions on access awhile back.

I must be misremembering, my bad.

They purge inactive accounts.

I've had my own since I started back when Diana was just brought out. Never lost access and I log in for a few days every new patch to test out the changes. Lots of older players still have their own accounts too. Age of your account, whether you actually test stuff, etc. all take into affect if you get purged.

They actually regularly purge accounts. I had one last year, and when I tried to login 2 months ago it said that the account did not exist anymore. I was like "...what?" seeing as I went on and commented on the forums often. I guess I had a break period.

Also like 60% of people on it are not serious. It's rare to see people want to do anything other than test new champions to take them into ranked.

That's in part, the point.

The other part is that Zed isn't simply uncatchable with his ult. There's actual risk to using it now (if small), as opposed to being a "get out of Requiem free" card.

How big the actual impact is, I'm not entirely sure. I haven't faced a Zed since the nerf. I played *with* one though who apparently didn't read patch notes; and flipped sh*t over being killed because of a "bug".

Pretty much this.  If you're actually going in, you're going to be spending enough time dealing damage that the delay won't matter.  

Really it just shuts up the people who claim he can ult in, pop right back out, and still deal massive damage.  Seriously, anyone that wastes his ult like that deserves to lose.
Everybody is a sheep. Urgot was considered a troll pick, but oh, some guy on the LCS picked him, suddenly everybody's lining up to blow him.

You gotta add that Urgot recently got buffed, i mean he has 8% max mana scaling on his shield, which is a huge buff to a champ that almost ALWAYS built {{item:3004}}  + {{item:3110}} .

But you are right, there are so many picks out there that are not considered just because 80% of league community are sheeps that are also afraid to experiment build and follow the meta strictly.

That buff ultimately amounted to a bonus 200 shield power. It's a lot, don't get me wrong, but it alone didn't propel Urgot to LCS darling. And it CERTAINLY didn't adress the issues that people bitched about before he was played by an LCS bigshot.

"Bigshot"


Keane isn't really a "bigshot" but eh, opinions.

Still Urgot was considered a "troll pick", the buffs and this meta are what helped him come to a power point. When this meta dissipates(which it will eventually) he will probably fall out of favor.

wat....

cho is strong, certainly, i should know because he was one of the first champs i really picked up and did good with when i first got back in to league after i got better internet.  But he certainly isnt op.  Basically if you pick cho in lane, unless your bad at laning period, you entire goal is to win lane by not dieing and feeding on farm.  So, what do you not do against an enemy cho without jungler support at level 2? Do not try to kill him, let alone without a minion advantage.  Granted that's common sense, but still.  Its definitely not him being op.

Zed's swap back quickly all the time. I just saw Mickey do it in G2 of Anarchy vs Najin, LCK Summer Split Week 1 Day 1.

If you ult as Zed, the enemy can often flash/blink you (or have their teammates flash/blink in) to put you in a situation where you risk being cc'd and bursted if you don't swap back immediately.

People love to say dumb shit like "good zeds will only use their ult in X way, this never affects them." Talking in absolutes is dumb as shit, league games are chaotic and shit happens, pretending games play out in exactly X way every time is stupid.

It does affect him especially against champions like Riven who would immediately W when Zed finish his ult Animation however Zed could avoid this by reactivating ult and avoid her W and then shadow forward and fight her and possibly kill her or bail whatever is most optimal (or just save the shadow if Riven still wants to fight and is chasing Zed)

Though I don't think it really kills him or anything

I'm a Zed main and I picked Zed in a ranked match as first pick. One of the guys on my team told me not to pick him, cause most in Silver sucked at him. I told him that I'm one of them better Zed players and so I proceeded to go 23/2 and carry the game hard to victory.

But to be honest, I have seen so many bad Zeds, it's actually unreal.

The average Zed player with just 1-5 games with him has a 44% win rate, while Zed players with 125 or more have 55%. Zed is OP if you know how to play him. Don't first pick him in ranked just because people say he's strong.
